rows.THE SCHOOL MODEL: The company runs as a school. Programs, semesters, curricula, grades.
THE CONCEPT
The business is organized as a school with 6 programs.
Each program runs in 12-week semesters.
Every employee is a student executing a curriculum.
The Operator is the best student who became the teacher who became the dean.
The CoS is the registrar — manages enrollment, tracks progress, ensures standards.
The CM is the accreditation body — grades the school, not the students.
Studio (Nilo) is the university system — sets standards, provides frameworks, launches schools.
This is not a metaphor. This is the organizational frame.
WHY SCHOOL:
• Schools have curricula — defined learning paths with clear milestones
• Schools have semesters — time-boxed periods with start/end/evaluation
• Schools have grades — standardized performance measurement
• Schools have graduation — clear criteria for when you're done
• Schools have programs — specialized tracks with their own logic
• Schools separate the system from the person — the curriculum exists independent of the student
This maps perfectly to how a Trade operates:
• The ODD is the textbook
• Each TUP is a course assignment
• Each semester is a 12-week sprint
• Each grade is a Trade Scorecard assessment
• Graduation = the business can run without the founder
